chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0
x: Z_Zp

Goal:
x ⊕ Zp = x

Premises:
Z_Zp = {x : nat | x < p} : Set
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Notation Zp := Zp_zero
Zp_plus_zero : forall x, Zp ⊕ x = x
Zp_minus : forall x, x ⊕ ∸ x = Zp
Zp_prime_invert : prime p -> forall x, x <> Zp -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}

Zp_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list Z_Zp) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ (gen_phiZ Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult ∸) id_phi_N (pow_N Op Zp_mult) l pe2
Zp_plus_assoc : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊕ y ⊕ z
Zp_plus_comm : forall x y, x ⊕ y = y ⊕ x
Zp_plus_inj_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ y = x ⊕ z -> y = z
Zp_mult_plus_distr_r : forall x y z : Z_Zp, (y ⊕ z) ⊗ x = y ⊗ x ⊕ z ⊗ x
Zp_mult_plus_distr_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊗ y ⊕ x ⊗ z
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
Zp_is_ring = {| Radd_0_l := Zp_plus_zero; Radd_comm := Zp_plus_comm; Radd_assoc := Zp_plus_assoc; Rmul_1_l := Zp_mult_one; Rmul_comm := Zp_mult_comm; Rmul_assoc := Zp_mult_assoc; Rdistr_l := fun x y z : Z_Zp => Zp_mult_plus_distr_r z x y; Rsub_def := fun x y => eq_refl; Ropp_def := Zp_minus |} : ring_theory Zp Op Zp_plus Zp_mult (fun x y => x ⊕ ∸ y) ∸ eq
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m
Nat.add_sub_eq_nz : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n - m = p -> m + p = n
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
div_rem_uniq : forall p n1 r1 n2 r2 : nat, p <> 0 -> n1 * p + r1 = n2 * p + r2 -> r1 < p -> r2 < p -> n1 = n2 /\ r1 = r2
Nat.div_mod : forall x y : nat, y <> 0 -> x = y * (x / y) + x mod y
div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p
Nat2Pos.inj : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m <> 0 -> Pos.of_nat n = Pos.of_nat m -> n = m
Nat.pred_inj : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m <> 0 -> Nat.pred n = Nat.pred m -> n = m
Nat2Pos.inj_iff : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m <> 0 -> Pos.of_nat n = Pos.of_nat m < -> n = m
div_full : forall q p : nat, {n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}
Nat.eq_mul_0_l : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> m <> 0 -> n = 0
Nat.mul_eq_0_r : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> n <> 0 -> m = 0
Nat.eq_mul_0_r : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> n <> 0 -> m = 0
Nat.mul_eq_0_l : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> m <> 0 -> n = 0
Zp_zero = exist (fun x : nat => x < p) 0 ((fun lemma : 0 < p <-> (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (0 < p) (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z lt Z.of_nat Z.lt Nat2Z.inj_lt 0 0%Z eq_refl p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl) (let Hp0 : Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z := ZifyClasses.rew_iff (p <> 0) (Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.not_morph (p = 0) (Z.of_nat p = 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z eq Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl 0 0%Z eq_refl)) Hp in let cstr : (0 <= Z.of_nat p)%Z := Nat2Z.is_nonneg p in let __arith : forall __x1 : Z, (...
Nat.divide_mul_split : forall n m p : nat, n <> 0 -> Nat.divide n (m * p) -> exists q r : nat, n = q * r /\ Nat.divide q m /\ Nat.divide r p
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
Nat.div_exact : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> a = b * (a / b) < -> a mod b = 0
utils_nat.first_non_zero : forall (f : nat -> nat) (n : nat), f 0 = 0 -> f n <> 0 -> exists i : nat, i < n /\ (forall k : nat, k <= i -> f k = 0) /\ f (i + 1) <> 0
Nat.mod_divides : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> a mod b = 0 < -> (exists c : nat, a = b * c)
Nat.mul_divide_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> Nat.divide (n * p) (m * p) < -> Nat.divide n m
Nat.mul_id_l : forall n m : nat, m <> 0 -> n * m = m < -> n = 1
Nat.mul_id_r : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> n * m = n < -> m = 1
Nat2Pos.id : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> Pos.to_nat (Pos.of_nat n) = n
Nat.succ_pred : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> S (Nat.pred n) = n
Nat.div_unique_exact : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a = b * q -> q = a / b
Nat.divide_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (exists p : nat, y = p * x) (exists p : nat, y = p * x') (Morphisms_Prop.ex_iff_morphism (fun p : nat => y = p * x) (fun p : nat => y = p * x') (fun p : nat => Morphisms.per_partial_app_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Nat.eq_equiv) (p * x) (p * x') (Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism Nat.mul_wd (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive p) x x' Hx))) (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (exists p : nat, y' = p * x')) (Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff...

``` 
unfold Z_Zp. unfold "=*" at 1. unfold eq_rect_r at 1. unfold eq_rect at 1. unfold eq_sym at 1. apply Zp_ring_ring_lemma2 with (n:=O). simpl. intros. apply Zp_plus_zero.
